data.Title: Google Core Update Expected in Coming Weeks
data.Description: Google has announced that the next core update to its search algorithm is expected to roll out in the coming weeks.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Chat Feature Disabled
data.Description: The new chat feature within Google Business Profiles has stopped working, with users no longer able to initiate new chats. Google recommends downloading chat history.

data.Title: Google Tests AI-Powered Features for Search
data.Description: Google is experimenting with several new AI-driven features for search, including simulating "idle" states for better JavaScript rendering, testing an "AI Overview" button, highlighting search result words in blue with light backgrounds, and piloting AI-organized local search results.

data.Title: Google Notes on Search Experiment Ends
data.Description: Google has officially ended its "Notes on Search" experiment, which allowed users to add notes to search results. The company stated that research indicated people prefer hearing from others like themselves.

data.Title: Google Explores Site-Level AI Content Classification
data.Description: There are indications that Google may be developing a site-level score to classify the extent of artificially generated content.  Industry experts express a desire for Google to improve its detection of sites heavily reliant on AI-generated content.

data.Title: Google Discover Content Exclusion for Publishers Considered
data.Description: Google is exploring the possibility of allowing publishers to exclude specific content from appearing in Google Discover feeds.

data.Title: Taboola Partners with Apple for Native Advertising
data.Description: Taboola has secured a deal with Apple to power native advertising within the Apple News and Apple Stocks apps, leading to a surge in Taboola's stock price.

data.Title: AI Training Datasets Raise Copyright Concerns
data.Description: An investigation reveals that AI models from companies like Apple, Nvidia, and Anthropic were trained on datasets containing YouTube video transcripts, including content from sources like the Wall Street Journal, MrBeast, and MIT, raising concerns about copyright and data usage.

data.Title: Reddit and Quora Citations Decline in Google AI Overviews
data.Description: A new report from BrightEdge indicates a significant decrease in the number of citations from Reddit and Quora appearing in Google's AI Overviews feature.

data.Title: Google Engages with Creators on Search Algorithm Impacts
data.Description: Google held a meeting with creators, including HouseFresh and RetroDodo, to discuss the effects of recent search algorithm updates. The meeting was attended by Google's Search Quality team.

data.Title: Google Expands 3D/AR Image Feature
data.Description: Google appears to be rolling out its 3D/AR image feature to a wider range of websites, beyond those initially included in the pilot program.

data.Title: Google Downplays Importance of Disavow Files
data.Description: John Mueller of Google has stated that website owners should not be overly concerned about having large disavow files or removing them, suggesting they have minimal impact on search rankings.

data.Title: Schema.org Receives Design Update
data.Description: The Schema.org website has been redesigned, featuring an updated validator and a refreshed visual style.

data.Title: Majestic Removes Disavow Links Feature
data.Description: Majestic, an SEO tool provider, has removed its disavow links feature, following a trend also seen with Bing. This move reflects a decreasing emphasis on disavowing links within the SEO community.

data.Title: Google Updates URL Best Practices
data.Description: Google has updated its URL best practices documentation, advising against using fragments (the part of a URL after the '#') to change page content.
